headline: GOP Rep. Bob Gibbs announces retirement, calls Ohio’s redistricting fight a 'circus'
author: Nick Castele
sentences:

In a statement issued Wednesday, former President Donald Trump congratulated Gibbs on a “wonderful and accomplished career” and called him a “strong ally to me and MAGA.”
Following the Jan. 6 Capitol insurrection, Gibbs voted against impeaching Trump.

Gibbs, who made the announcement on social media this morning, said in a statement that Ohio’s redistricting fight had become a “circus.” Still he said he was confident in the Republican prospects for retaking the House in this year’s midterms.
The current new Congressional map drew Gibbs into a primary with Max Miller, a former aide in the Trump White House.
Miller originally set out to challenge Anthony Gonzalez, who is also retiring from Congress.
Since 2011, I’ve had the honor of serving the people of Ohio’s 18th, then 7th District.
A former state lawmaker, Gibbs was elected to Congress in the Republican wave of 2010.
Ohio Republican Bob Gibbs announced Wednesday that he is retiring from Congress.
He also voted to overturn the 2020 presidential election results.
